column4: Hi. I've got a bit of a problem here... When I enter my password in LightDM and press enter the screen just flickers and goed straight back to LightDM

I think I might have removed a wron package or something >.< Yesterday I had a dependency hell while trying to install Unity 5.4. In installed the version from the normal repo's again but I might have forgotten to install a few packages. When I run startx manually from tty1 I just get a black background and a white cursor.
Could anyone help me with my somewhat extremely frustrating problem..?
We can't help ya if we don't know the problem.
Unity 5.4 isn't part of the official repository for Ubuntu 11.10 and older.
i know... i just said i reinstalled the one from the normal repo's (4.x). But i might have forgotten to install some packages again :s
they arent broken anymore.... because i installed the older ones again... i just think i forgot to install some vital package which causes lightdm to not being able to launch a unity session
Are you able to install another GUI such as gnome-shell from a terminal?
i can chroot into the system.... but do i have to install a lot of bloat? xD
I would say if you were logged into gnome-shell you can check Synaptic.
this is my lightdm log:
yeah but that shpws up in EVERY xorg lol and the problem only happened today
Are you able to boot into any other GUI or window manager besides Unity?
dunno havent got any :p
Figures if you can't boot into any other GUI or window manager it might actually be missing an nVidia driver.
but i saw something interesting in lightdm, which confirms my suspicions

I seen these two links: http://askubuntu.com/questions/66370/x11-doesnt-start-after-clean-11-10-install-dell-e6500-nvidia-8gb-ram-i386 and http://askubuntu.com/questions/90915/troubleshooting-x-server-ee-failed-to-load-module-nv-module-does-not-exist
What happened when you tried the suggestion from that forum?
i got into a new dependency hell :D
Open a terminal and type: cat /usr/share/xsessions
Oops I meant to type: ls /usr/share/xsessions
